ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: I have a sense of a connection with God or higher power.
Notes: 1 = Not true in my life; 2 = Rarely true in my life; 3 = Sometimes true in my life; 4 = Often true in my life; 5 = Almost always true in my life; -999 = Not applicable (e.g. = you do not believe in a higher power)

ElementDescription: My spirituality provides meaning in my life.
Notes: 1 = Not true in my life; 2 = Rarely true in my life; 3 = Sometimes true in my life; 4 = Often true in my life; 5 = Almost always true in my life; -999 = Not applicable (e.g. = you do not believe in a higher power)

ElementDescription: I am aware of the presence God, higher power, or ultimate reality in my life.
Notes: 1 = Not true in my life; 2 = Rarely true in my life; 3 = Sometimes true in my life; 4 = Often true in my life; 5 = Almost always true in my life; -999 = Not applicable (e.g. = you do not believe in a higher power)

ElementDescription: I believe that God or another higher power is concerned about me.
Notes: 1 = Not true in my life; 2 = Rarely true in my life; 3 = Sometimes true in my life; 4 = Often true in my life; 5 = Almost always true in my life; -999 = Not applicable (e.g. = you do not believe in a higher power)

ElementDescription: I try to incorporate my spirituality into all aspects of my life.
Notes: 1 = Not true in my life; 2 = Rarely true in my life; 3 = Sometimes true in my life; 4 = Often true in my life; 5 = Almost always true in my life; -999 = Not applicable (e.g. = you do not believe in a higher power)

ElementDescription: My spiritual beliefs define my understanding of the world.
Notes: 1 = Not true in my life; 2 = Rarely true in my life; 3 = Sometimes true in my life; 4 = Often true in my life; 5 = Almost always true in my life; -999 = Not applicable (e.g. = you do not believe in a higher power)

ElementDescription: When I face challenges, I understand my life as part of God's or a bigger plan.
Notes: 1 = Not true in my life; 2 = Rarely true in my life; 3 = Sometimes true in my life; 4 = Often true in my life; 5 = Almost always true in my life; -999 = Not applicable (e.g. = you do not believe in a higher power)

ElementDescription: My faith or spirituality is a big part of who I am.
Notes: 1 = Not true in my life; 2 = Rarely true in my life; 3 = Sometimes true in my life; 4 = Often true in my life; 5 = Almost always true in my life; -999 = Not applicable (e.g. = you do not believe in a higher power)

ElementDescription: My religious beliefs are most closely related to:
Notes: 1 = Atheism (I do not believe in God or gods/goddesses); 2 = Agnosticism (God or gods/goddesses may exist = but we can never be certain); 3 = Buddhism; 4 = Christianity; 5 = Hinduism; 6 = Islam; 7 = Judaism; 8 = Native or Traditional Spirituality; 9 = Paganism; 10 = Sikhism

ElementDescription: How many times in the past 90 days did you attend religious services (e.g., church, Temple)? [past 180 days for follow up visits]
